title: 109_hr3956
content: The Act may be cited as the "Savings for the Uninsured on Rx Expenses (SURE) Act of 2005". It includes a Drug Discount Card Program. The "Savings for the Uninsured on Rx Expenses (SURE) Act of 2005" establishes a prescription drug discount card program endorsed by the Secretary of Health and Human Services. The program aims to provide access to prescription drug discounts for eligible individuals throughout the United States, modeled after the medicare prescription drug discount card program. The deadline for implementation is within 6 months of the Act's enactment, and participation in the program is voluntary. The Act establishes a prescription drug discount card program endorsed by the Secretary of Health and Human Services. Eligible individuals are not required to enroll in the program, which will be administered separately from the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services. The Secretary may issue regulations for implementation. Eligible individuals include U.S. citizens, nationals, lawful permanent residents, or other aliens permanently residing in the U.S. The Act establishes a prescription drug discount card program for eligible individuals in the United States. Eligible individuals include U.S. citizens, nationals, lawful permanent residents, or other aliens permanently residing in the U.S. Those eligible are not required to enroll in the program, which will be administered separately from the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services. Outpatient prescription drug coverage refers to coverage of prescription drugs on an outpatient basis under various health insurance programs. The Act establishes a prescription drug discount card program for eligible individuals in the United States, including U.S. citizens, nationals, lawful permanent residents, or other aliens permanently residing in the U.S. The program is administered separately from the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services and covers outpatient prescription drugs. Covered discount card drugs are defined as those covered under section 1860D-2(e) of the Social Security Act. Enrollment and enrollment fees follow the provisions of section 1860D-31, with specific enrollment forms established for this program. The program establishes an annual open enrollment process for eligible individuals with no prorated enrollment fee. There are no special provisions for transitional assistance, and the limitation on enrollment before January 1, 2006, does not apply. Information on enrollment follows the provisions of the section in the same manner. The program establishes an annual open enrollment process for eligible individuals with no prorated enrollment fee. Information disseminated includes details on using health savings accounts for prescription drugs with discounts. A toll-free number is provided for inquiries, excluding Medicare options. Special provisions for transitional assistance do not apply. The program requires sponsors of prescription drug discount card programs to have a marketing plan to reach eligible individuals. The Secretary will use information on Medicare eligibility and other eligibility information for verification. The Secretary will use eligibility information from the Departments of Veterans Affairs and Defense for verification. There is no judicial review for decisions on endorsing or contracting with prescription drug card sponsors.
